intro: Pyrrocoma racemosa, commonly known as the raceme pyrrocoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
